liberar execucao de scripts. Abrir o power shell em modo admin:
Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted

install npm:
npm install -g npm

npm install 

create vite project:
npm create vite@latest

npm run dev

checar versÃµes:
npm view react version
node -v

gerar build
npm run build

---------------------------------
GIT
---------------------------------
git push -u origin main

---------------------------------
useState
---------------------------------
https://react.dev/learn/updating-arrays-in-state

setPerson({
  ...person, // Copy the old fields
  firstName: e.target.value // But override this one
});

Updating state based on the previous state 
function sumAge() {
  setAge(a => a + 1); // setAge(42 => 43)
  setAge(a => a + 1); // setAge(43 => 44)
  setAge(a => a + 1); // setAge(44 => 45)
}

Updating state based on the previous state 
const [age, setAge] = useState(42);

function increment() {
  setAge(a => a + 1);
}

setProjectState((prevState) => {
  const newProject = {
    ...projectData,
    id: Math.random(),
  };

//adding item
setArtists( // Replace the state
  [ // with a new array
    ...artists, // that contains all the old items
    { id: nextId++, name: name } // and one new item at the end
  ]
);

//replacing the values
setPlayerData({
  ...playerData,
  name: playerName.current.value,
  class: playerClass.current.value,
  power: 10,
  defense: 10,
});

//estranho
function handleAddNewPlayer(player) {
    console.log("receba", player);

    const oldPlayerData = [...playerData];
    const playerToUpdate = oldPlayerData.find(
      (p) => p.id === player.id
    );
    playerToUpdate.name = player.name;
    setPlayerData(oldPlayerData);
  }
